ygData.subject: Functions not found - Installation problem?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello everybody, I have installed Cantera 1.5 on a Mandrake 9.1 Linux distributiun. The setup procedure worked fine and now I am trying to make a few first

Subject: Functions not found - Installation problem?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=185650710
X-Yahoo-Profile: danielschanz

Hello everybody,

I have installed Cantera 1.5 on a Mandrake 9.1 Linux distributiun. The
setup procedure worked fine and now I am trying to make a few first
steps, so I am basically working my way through the C++-documentation. 
When using the example-program, I run into problems:

In Listing 2.1 I had to include "IdealGasMix.h" (which is not done in
the Listing), otherwise the compiler did not know the
IdealGasMix-routine. Furthermore, a call to 

IdealGasMix g(fname)

(with fname being "gri30.xml") will compile, but results in an 
Cantera-Error on execution. When changin this line to something 
of the type 

IdealGasMix g("gri30.xml", "gri30") 
everything works fine.
In Listing 3.1 I have to include "equilibrium.h" in order to get 

equilibrate(gas, TP)

to be recognized.
The

printSummary(g,cout)

-Function is do not found at all (and I cant't find it in the
cantera-Files either), so the code is not compiled.

Were there a lot of changes in the 1.5 - Version, so that the Listings
do not work anymore or is there something wrong in my Installation
(Paths, Makefile, etc)?

I would be very thankful for any hints, thanks in advance

Daniel Schanz, University of Goettingen
